ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Re: neglecting our families?
ygData.msgSnippet: UO is ultima online which i ve never played...  i do know for sure though that it s not the same as everquest...  now on to business...  i didnt find
ygData.messageBody:
UO is ultima online which i've never played... i do know for sure though
that it's not the same as everquest... now on to business... i didnt find
"snooping" disturbing... I assumed you had found something durring your
search.. i have an eq friend... his wife played as well... she ended up
meeting men on the game and it led to affairs irl and eventually a
divorce... he got the best revenge of course... guessed her password and
stole her beloved main character lol... i think she deserved it. if you
find your "snooping" to be disturbing i'm not going to argue with you.
certainly after the revalation that she had done nothing wrong. now about
game talk being "insipid dribble"... what would you prefer people to talk
about while playing the game? sex??? you didnt seem happy when she was
showing concern for your happiness to her "guildies". OH by the way, those
blips and flickering lights on the screen represent real living people. we
are the people they represent... WE are everquest. dont expect a
sympathetic ear from me when you complain to me about the effect people like
me have had on your life. if i feel badly about anything, i feel for your
financial situation, although it's not my fault (and dont blame everquest...
your WIFE made the decision to quit her job (and a poor decision it was)
guns dont kill people, criminals with guns kill people) i really pity you.
you say she's getting better? GOOD!!!! Quit making your daughter cry by
obsessing over "mommy's eq". Go on with your life and try as hard as she
is!!! If i were your wife i would have left you for a sane man a long time
ago... of course if i were your wife i would probably be just as insane and
do things like quitting jobs to play video games and sleeping on the couch
until noon... there's plenty more opinions where this came from if you care
to take offense instead of advice from what i've said. just dont expect to
change my mind by repeating yourself. i've heard how bad your life was.
life tends to suck from time to time. that's what makes these happy times
so darn good. you say life is good now. GO LIVE IT!

>From: "Dave" <zedzink@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
>To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EQ_women] Re: neglecting our families?
>Date: Wed, 09 Jul 2003 02:45:11 -0000
>
>I pour out my life story of my marriage to an EQ fiend, who stopped
>everything else in her life for a game...and you find my snooping to
>be disturbing?? All depends on your point of view, I guess...
>
>Never found any evidence of any online or RL affairs (as many EQ
>widows and widowers have experienced); just line after line of
>insipid dribble about ports, spells, gear, etc, occassionally
>puncuated by a nasty reference to me ("Hubby getting upset again
>better log soon :( ")
>
>Oh, and as for the Lexus...sorry, can't help you there. In fact,
>when ours is done, we'll likely have to replace it with a Toyota or
>Nissan; since she quit her $30K job back in 2000 to play UO (then EQ)
>fulltime, some cutbacks have become necessary.
>
>
